info.name: Restful Booker Test Fork
info.description:
This collection demonstrates different ways to perform CRUD web API testing. It uses different test validations with different request and response formats (i.e., JSON, XML, and form URL encoded data).

The web service API used is Restfulbooker API which can be found in this [link](https://restful-booker.herokuapp.com/apidoc/index.html).

request.description: Sends a ping request to the Restfulbooker API to determine if the service is up. The API documentation can be found in this [link](https://restful-booker.herokuapp.com/apidoc/index.html#api-Ping-Ping).

exec: console.log(`${pm.info.requestName}: token property does not exist!`);
// if this data variable exist, then a data file is in use

request.description:
Sends an authentication request to create a new auth token. The token can be saved and later used for the PUT and DELETE /booking requests.

The API documentation can be found in this [link](https://restful-booker.herokuapp.com/apidoc/index.html#api-Auth-CreateToken).

request.description: Sends a request to the Restfulbooker API to retrieve the list of all available booking IDs without any search filter. The response is expected to have an array of JSON object with a bookingid property. The API documentation can be found in this [link](https://restful-booker.herokuapp.com/apidoc/index.html#api-Booking-GetBookings).

item.name: Get Booking IDs with Filter by Name  - JSON

request.description: Sends a request to the Restfulbooker API to retrieve the list of all available booking IDs with search filter for first and last name. The response is expected to have an array of JSON object with a bookingid property if the first name and last name match the search filters. The API documentation can be found in this[link](https://restful-booker.herokuapp.com/apidoc/index.html#api-Booking-GetBookings).

response.name: Get Booking IDs with Filter by Name- JSON
Get Booking IDs with Filter by Name- JSON (Mock)

item.name: Get Booking IDs with Filter by Date  - JSON

exec: pm.test("#TEST: Get Booking IDs Filter by Date Request: Status code is 200", function () {
pm.test("#TEST: Get Booking IDs Filter by Date - JSON: JSON response data validation", () => {
console.error("JSON response data validation failed! " + e);
pm.test("#TEST: Get Booking IDs Filter by Date - JSON: JSON response schema validation", () => {
pm.test("#TEST: Get Booking IDs Filter by Date - JSON: Booking ID validation", () => {
console.log("#TEST: Get Booking IDs Filter by Date - List of Booking empty");
// send a request to get booking details for each booking ID returned
pm.test("#TEST: Get Booking IDs Filter by Date - JSON: Checkin and Checkout Date validation", () => {
//validate checkin and checkout date of each booking id
console.log("Filter by checkin=" + checkin + " and checkout=" + checkout);
//pm.expect(_.gte(jsonData2.bookingdates.checkin, checkin), "Returned checkin date " + jsonData2.bookingdates.checkin + " should be >= " + checkin);
"Returned checkin date " + jsonData2.bookingdates.checkin + " should be >= " + checkin).to.be.true;
//pm.expect(_.lte(jsonData2.bookingdates.checkout, checkout), "Returned checkout date " + jsonData2.bookingdates.checkout + " should be <= " + checkout);
"Returned checkout date " + jsonData2.bookingdates.checkout + " should be <= " + checkout).to.be.true;

query.description: Check-in date filter in YYYY-MM-DD format.
Check-out date filter in YYYY-MM-DD format.

request.description: Sends a request to the Restfulbooker API to retrieve the list of all available booking IDs with search filter for check in and check out dates. The response is expected to have an array of JSON object with a bookingid property if the booking dates fall between the search filter dates (inclusive). The API documentation can be found in this[link](https://restful-booker.herokuapp.com/apidoc/index.html#api-Booking-GetBookings).

variable.value:
{
    "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema",
    "$id": "http://example.com/example.json",
    "type": "object",
    "title": "The root schema",
    "description": "The root schema comprises the entire JSON document.",
    "default": {},
    "examples": [
        {
            "firstname": "Francis",
            "lastname": "Kutch",
            "totalprice": "790",
            "depositpaid": "true",
            "bookingdates[checkin]": "2021-08-10",
            "bookingdates[checkout]": "2023-01-02",
            "additionalneeds": "circuit"
        }
    ],
    "required": [
        "firstname",
        "lastname",
        "totalprice",
